awd_titl_txt: Inelastic Deformation of Sandwich Plates and Shells Under   Dynamic Loading
awd_abstract_narration: The objective of this research is to analyze theoretically and                  experimentally the nonlinear material characteristics, structural               responses and optimization of motor cycle helmets and other                     protective devices.  It will be conducted in conjunction with a                 parallel study, which will be funded by the  Air Force Office of                Scientific Research, on the generic experimental and theoretical                analyses of impacted crushable shells.                                          This particular research will start with two major thrusts involving            the impact responses of crushable half cylindrical/semi-circular                shells and the development of a model which simulates a human head.             These two research thrusts will be combined during the third year for           the optimization study.                                                         The two principal investigators are highly respected researchers in             their respective fields of impact mechanics, which includes head                injury studies, and structural mechanics.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
